title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:21 <abusenius> has quit  
01:32 <florinciu> has quit  
02:51 <sdumitriu> has quit  
03:37 <DrLou> has quit  
05:46 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
05:49 <venkatesh> has quit  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
06:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:20 <lucaa> has quit  
07:12 <@cjdelisle> WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO  
07:12 <@cjdelisle> That bug lasted a long time.  
07:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:41 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> has quit  
08:37 <lucaa> has quit  
08:37 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <jstoldt> good morning  
08:45 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
08:57 <jstoldt> how's the progress on your pseudo DBMS?  
08:59 <mflorea> has quit  
09:05 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <+sburjan> morning all  
09:06 <jstoldt> morning :)  
09:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <@cjdelisle> M1 comes out on the 7th right?  
09:43 <@cjdelisle> oh M2, got my numbering mixed up again.  
09:43 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <lucaa> has quit  
09:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> good morning  
09:57 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
09:58 <vmassol> cjdelisle: when are you doing the move to platform for xwiki-store?  
09:58 <vmassol> btw I hope you have a good test suite :)  
09:58 <@cjdelisle> about 5 minutes ago  
09:58 <vmassol> (haven't checked the code)  
09:58 <vmassol> oh :)  
09:59 <vmassol> the @since should be 3.0M2 btw  
09:59 <vmassol> I see you've used 3.0M1  
09:59 <vmassol> but 3.0M1 is already released  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> That's in the naxt patch.  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> Hopefully it's the worst mistake of the commit  
09:59 <jstoldt> just an idea for the future of the file based storage: how about creating a possibility  to zip-compress various types attachments stored on the FS?  
10:00 <vmassol> yeah :)  
10:00 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <jstoldt> like being able to zip office documents and probably some other text formats  
10:01 <jstoldt> auto zip, obviously  
10:01 <+lucaa> vmassol: I re-enabled the tests on the annotations last night and it seems they haven't failed on hudson  
10:01 <+lucaa> also I could run them fine on my machine  
10:01 <vmassol> strange  
10:01 <+lucaa> so as I suspected, it's an encoding issue  
10:01 <+lucaa> I don't know which one yet  
10:01 <@cjdelisle> re tests: The primative functions (TransactionRunnable and the serializers) are tested very well (IMO) the attachment save/load part has "happy path" tests but could be better, it's very difficult testing code which interfaces with a "rat's nest" dependency structure.  
10:01 <+lucaa> nor how to fix it  
10:01 <+lucaa> but  
10:01 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <jstoldt> talking about XWIKI-5913 there?  
10:02 <+lucaa> if you still have issues with that test, we'll disable that test case only  
10:02 <+sburjan> fingers crossed :)  
10:02 <+lucaa> jstoldt: no  
10:02 <jstoldt> oh, okay  
10:03 <@cjdelisle> There is a one issue I know of that the lock complains when an attachment is deleted. I don't think it's serious and it should be fixed within the day.  
10:06 <vmassol> disabling a test is bad because it means the test is not useful…. if it's useful it needs to be fixed ;)  
10:07 <+lucaa> vmassol: I'm wondering if I should still say that I know :). But if you cannot build locally and I cannot find the time to fix it, we can disable it, \_temporarily\_.  
10:07 <+lucaa> of course it  
10:07 <+lucaa> it's useful  
10:08 <vmassol> what I mean is that a breaking test deserve all our attention in priority before other things  
10:08 <@cjdelisle> There is no disabled test. That's interesting, the lock does not complain in the test.  
10:08 <@cjdelisle> oh  
10:09 <vmassol> :)  
10:37 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you give me a feedback on this ?  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/ManualTestReportTemplateIteration2  
10:59 <vmassol> sburjan: sure, what should I look at specifically?  
11:00 <vmassol> "Check if Link feature works properly" is pretty generic. IMO expected column need to be precise  
11:00 <+sburjan> I added the "Expected Result" Column. You don't need to read it all, justtell me if it integrates (today I'll polish it by making the columns the same size to have morevisual consistency")  
11:00 <+sburjan> okay. I will polish that  
11:00 <+sburjan> I have these type of comments also on WYSIWYG table  
11:01 <vmassol> also are these tests excluding automatic tests, ie non overlapping?  
11:01 <vmassol> got to go, bb in 15  
11:02 <+sburjan> no, this is Manual Tests that has everything.  
11:02 <+sburjan> vmassol: signal when you're back, i have a few more questions  
11:15 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-817  
11:15 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-817  
11:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <@cjdelisle> user@debo8:~/wrk/xwiki.clone/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-store$ find ./xwiki-store-transaction/src/main -name '\*.java' -exec cat {} \; | grep -v '^\s\*\\*' | grep -v '^\s\*/' | wc -l | sed 's/^\([^ ]\*\) .\*$/\1/' | tr '\n' '+' | sed 's/^\(.\*\)+$/print \1 ;/' | perl ; echo  
11:35 <@cjdelisle> 411  
11:35 <@cjdelisle> it's easy to forget how few lines actually are in the transaction module.  
11:36 <@cjdelisle> That's line count excluding comments and tests  
11:37 <@cjdelisle> 350 if you exclude whitespace lines too  
11:44 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <@cjdelisle> Anyone opposed to a long <description> element in a pom.xml?  
11:56 <@cjdelisle> [brag brag brag brag brag...]  
12:40 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:55 <mflorea> has quit  
12:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:58 <jstoldt> has quit  
13:08 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: @since should be M2, not M1  
13:08 <@sdumitriu> Ah, you've fixed it already  
13:19 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: good morning, http://xwiki.pastebin.com/5ywrMMeA <-- WDYT?  
13:20 <@cjdelisle> My stuff can live without it but it really should be changed.  
13:20 <@sdumitriu> -0  
13:20 <@sdumitriu> IMO it's going in the wrong place  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> Attachments aren't the responsibility of the main store  
13:21 <@cjdelisle> It's definitly in the wrong place now. save() then alter is bad.  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> But the other place isn't better  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> (XHS)  
13:22 <@sdumitriu> XWIKI-1982  
13:23 <@cjdelisle> "But the other place isn't better" IMO it's better because it does not depend on undefined behavior.  
13:23 <@cjdelisle> Undefined behavior is worse then the most horrible code.  
13:23 <@cjdelisle> (IMO)  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> Why do you say it's undefined?  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> To save something and then alter it and rely on the change being saved?  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> If save() actually saved at that moment then it would not work correctly.  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> ?  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> WDYM save then alter?  
13:25 <@cjdelisle> It's relying on what is arguably a bug in hibernate.  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> You mean that:  
13:26 <@sdumitriu> Let me read the full code  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> Attachment version 1.2 is saved.  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> update() is called  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> then attachment archive is saved.  
13:27 <@cjdelisle> version number in the main attachment is bumped to 1.3 and date is set.  
13:27 <@cjdelisle> commit()  
13:27 <@cjdelisle> hibernete commits version 1.3 and new date.  
13:28 <@cjdelisle> but if it saved to the db when update() was called then it would be saving 1.2 with the old date.  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure?  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> OK, so the attachment metadata is saved in XHS  
13:29 <@cjdelisle> I know 1. it is 1.2 when update is called. 2. 1.3 is what ends up in the db.  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> Then the attachment content is saved in XHAS  
13:29 <@cjdelisle> correct  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> Which changes the attachment metadata, which was already saved  
13:29 <@sdumitriu> OK  
13:29 <@cjdelisle> This is the metadata that is at risk  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> I thought the attachment metadata is also saved in XHAS  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> OK, so your change is better, in theory  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> Let me check it's not causing a bug  
13:30 <@cjdelisle> s/better/less horrible/ ;)  
13:31 <@cjdelisle> That's what I'm worried about. IMO it's a critical bug fix but I am always very scared to force a change on XHS. IMO changes should be made modular and swapped in using config options.  
13:32 <@sdumitriu> OK, +1  
13:33 <@cjdelisle> You think it's safe right now or should we wait until 3.1?  
13:34 <@cjdelisle> If we want to wait, I can commit a big comment explaining the situation in XHS.  
13:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <@sdumitriu> Commit now  
13:45 <@cjdelisle> Ok  
14:03 <abusenius> has quit  
14:05 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <+sburjan> sdumitriu, cjdelisle do you think will we be able to release on 7th February (Monday) ?  
14:29 <@cjdelisle> Nothing I'm doing should hold it up.  
14:30 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-5945  
14:31 <+sburjan> so I guess tomorrow I should start testing the trunk snapshot  
14:31 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: wdyt ?  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> if anyone wants to know anything about the line of execution during an attachment save event, I can give you detailed answers, at least until it fades from memory ;)  
14:32 <+sburjan> write it down somewhere, maybe we'll need it in the documentation  
14:32 <@cjdelisle> It's pretty internal.  
14:32 <@cjdelisle> And hopefully that code's days are numbered :)  
14:33 <@cjdelisle> you can read the bug I linked to get an idea of what I was dealing with.  
14:36 <+sburjan> how did you fix the issue ?  
14:37 <+sburjan> oh, found  
14:38 <abusenius> has quit  
14:38 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <@cjdelisle> hey abusenius\_, you have a wpa isp?  
14:42 <+abusenius\_> cjdelisle: no, it's just how my university network called the host  
14:43 <@cjdelisle> ahh. I was going to say, I think wpa is just a key supplier for wep cipher so if you have the key then you could wireshark your neighbors.  
14:43 <+abusenius\_> yea, thats true :)  
14:43 <+abusenius\_> its wpa2 at least :)  
14:43 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
14:44 <@cjdelisle> I was thinking about maybe tinkering with wifi since I have some neighbors who are out of the loop but wpa is no good IMO.  
14:44 <@cjdelisle> Not if you can just sign up and eat everyone's cookies.  
14:47 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes  
14:48 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: yes meaning tomorrow I can start testing ?  
14:48 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:18 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what is the Secure WebDav port ?  
15:18 <@sdumitriu> No idea  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> Probably the same as https  
15:20 <+sburjan> works, thanks  
15:24 <+sburjan> I get an error in JIRA Filters : The value 'XPXML' does not exist for the field 'project'. ...... What is XPXML ? Was it removed ?  
15:25 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:25 <@sdumitriu> It was supposed to be a plugin for XML utilities  
15:25 <@sdumitriu> Never materialized.  
15:26 <@sdumitriu> It was recently implemented as a ScriptService component  
15:26 <@sdumitriu> Which filter?  
15:26 <+sburjan> let mec heck if "Open issues for XE/XEM/Platform"  is public and default or it's custom created by me  
15:27 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thanks for fixing the cache macro pom  
15:27 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10494  
15:28 <+sburjan> this seems it is public, created by vmassol  
15:28 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Even more broken on 2.7  
15:28 <@sdumitriu> Looks like the rendering APIs were changed a lot in 2.6 and 2.7  
15:28 <vmassol> sdumitriu: wdym? is there still a problem?  
15:28 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:28 <@sdumitriu> You committed them depending on 2.5 (wrong parent version)  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> But fixing the parent version causes compilation errors  
15:29 <vmassol> ah  
15:29 <vmassol> checking  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> The macro transformation was refactored  
15:29 <vmassol> 2.6 is ok?  
15:30 <@sdumitriu> Now yes  
15:30 <@sdumitriu> And on 2.7 looks like the macro package was renamed  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> Or no?  
15:31 <vmassol> checking 2.7 branch  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> I might have used the wrong scope for that dependency  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes, just the wrong scope  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: OK, fixed 2.7 as well  
15:34 <vmassol> ok  
15:37 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:37 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <@sdumitriu> Hudson builds usually fail at 4:00  
15:39 <@sdumitriu> Trying to change the crontab to delete only old versions  
15:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes there should be NO contab at all  
15:39 <vmassol> since we use nexus to perform the cleanup  
15:40 <vmassol> (in a correct manner)  
15:40 <vmassol> we're not allowed to remove files directly from the maven repo  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure?  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> On hudsonagent1?  
15:40 <vmassol> yes  
15:40 <vmassol> no  
15:40 <vmassol> I'm talking about the remote maven repo  
15:40 <vmassol> on maven.xwiki.org  
15:40 <@sdumitriu> I know, I'm talking about the build agents  
15:41 <vmassol> re local repos I don't think they're cleaned up by exus indeed  
15:41 <@sdumitriu> Which don't have nexus on them  
15:41 <vmassol> I wonder what's the canonical way of doing this cleanup  
15:41 <vmassol> (for the agents)  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> I used this:  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> find /home/hudsonagent/.m2/repository/com/xpn/ -ctime +7 -delete  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> Deletes files created at least 7 days ago  
15:48 <@sdumitriu> Maybe I should use -atime instead  
15:49 <@sdumitriu> Since it does a better cleanup for really unused files  
15:49 <+jvelociter> cjdelisle: humm too bad XWiki.ConfigurableClass calls context.dropPermissions() :(  
15:49 <+jvelociter> It means I cannot update dynamically the XWiki.XWikiPreferences class from my admin section  
15:49 <+jvelociter> (provided it has been saved with PR)  
15:59 <+jvelociter> what's odd is that though the permissions have been dropped, I am still able to execute groovy code  
15:59 <@sdumitriu> OK, changed to 0 7 \* \* \* find /home/hudsonagent/.m2/repository/ -atime +14 -delete  
16:00 <@sdumitriu> Just on agent 1  
16:00 <+jvelociter> so checkProgrammingRight() gives false, but I can bypass that by using reflection etc.  
16:00 <+jvelociter> IMO there is something fundamentally wrong  
16:01 <+jvelociter> for my use case I will just bypass all methods that do hasProgrammingRight check  
16:01 <+jvelociter> :p  
16:12 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:16 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: WDYT about a Glossary page?  
16:16 <@sdumitriu> Where we explain in short what something means  
16:16 <@sdumitriu> Sheet, Template, Class, Programming Rights, Application, etc  
16:17 <@sdumitriu> With links to further documentation  
16:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: re sheet/template we have a page for that  
16:17 <vmassol> yes glossary app would be great  
16:17 <vmassol> it's been asked frequently  
17:28 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:29 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <@cjdelisle> while(true){ try{ return; }finally{ continue; } }  
17:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes, that one was nice  
17:33 <@cjdelisle> should be an exception since finally is outside of it's containing block  
17:33 <@sdumitriu> The for break was nicer  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> The rest of the page might not be true anymore  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> Since it comments on Java 1.0.2  
17:34 <@cjdelisle> Yes, hopefully they fixed some of that. I know stop() is deprecated.  
17:58 <lucaa> has quit  
18:02 <vmassol> our sqale rating when back to B instead of A: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/plugins/resource/207147?page=com.sonarsource.sqale.ui.dashboard.SqaleDashboard  
18:03 <vmassol> something changed between 25 jan and 1st of Feb  
18:04 <vmassol> hmm trends can be seen here: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/components/index/207147  
18:04 <vmassol> maybe they adjusted the formula  
18:04 <DrLou> has quit  
18:10 <vito\_> has quit  
18:15 <vmassol> xwiki-core still takes more than 50% of all the code: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/plugins/resource/207147?page=org.sonar.plugins.radiator.RadiatorPage  
18:15 <vmassol> :(  
18:16 <@cjdelisle> I proposed removing some lines from XHS and I got a +0 ;)  
18:16 <@cjdelisle> Big gains to be had in scrapping JCRStore though.  
18:17 <+jvelociter> vmassol: but it does not even take 5% of coverage ;)  
18:24 <vmassol> jvelociter: note that they don't count functional tests (nor integration tests ie tests from a module exercising code from another module)  
18:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: is XWIKI-5917 fixed?  
18:26 <@sdumitriu> Why would it be?  
18:26 <@sdumitriu> Maybe if mflorea fixed it  
18:27 <@sdumitriu> Since the only idea I have is the - in the image name  
18:28 <@sdumitriu> Which gets URL-encoded wrongly  
18:29 <vmassol> I thought you made changes to the PDF export recently regarding images  
18:29 <abusenius> has quit  
18:29 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I didn't work on XWIKI-5917  
18:30 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I know, but you worked on something related to dashes in names  
18:30 <+mflorea> I fixed an issue regarding image path, but was for office import  
18:30 <@sdumitriu> So it shouldn't affect the HTML export  
18:31 <+mflorea> ah, the fix regarding dashes was in TempResourceAction  
18:32 <+mflorea> is the HTML export using the temp action to get the images?  
18:32 <+mflorea> I doubt it  
18:32 <@sdumitriu> Me too  
18:35 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: from the issue description the "file://" protocol is wrong, the URL should be relative to the directory when the HTML file is  
18:49 <vmassol> has quit
